clinical_study.brief_title: Exploratory Study of Effective Core Formula of Chinese Medicine to Treat Primary Insomnia

lead_sponsor.agency: China Academy of Chinese Medical Sciences

clinical_study.source: China Academy of Chinese Medical Sciences

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to screen the effective core formulation in insomnia treatment with Chinese medicine with a double-blind, randomized, placebo-controlled trial.

primary_outcome.measure: change from baseline in Total Sleep Time (TST) at 4 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: change from baseline in sleep onset latency at 4 weeks
change from baseline in wake time after sleep onset at 4 weeks
change from baseline in sleep efficiency at 4 weeks
change from baseline in Pittsburgh sleep quality index (PSQI) at 4 weeks
change from baseline in Chinese Medicine symptoms and signs at 4 weeks

arm_group.description: Chinese Medicine prescription of one of three prestigious Chinese medicine clinicians

intervention.description: The intervention of Chinese Medicine group is not fixed. The clinicians provide the prescription to patient base their own Chinese Medicine theory. Chinese clinicians can adjust the medicinal in prescription based on the condition of patient during the treatment procedure. The prescription of Chinese clinicians' are pure Chinese herb.

intervention.intervention_name: the dummy of a Chinese Medicine prescription
intervention.description: Patients in placebo group will receive the dummy of the core drug patterns screened in previous retrospective study. The previous core drug patterns include Fried semen Ziziphi Spinosae, Tuckahoe, Preparation of Polygala, Chinese Angelica root, Lotus heart, White peony root, dried tangerine peel, acorus calamus, Coptis chinensis, and Licorice health.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- aged between 18 and 65 years,
- meeting the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, 5th Edition (DSM-V) of insomnia,
- Spiegel scale score is ≥ 18,
- The informed consent must be obtained from patient
Exclusion Criteria:
- total sleep time ≤ 2 hours,
- secondary insomnia,
- Self-rating Anxiety Scale (SAS) score ≥ 18,
- Beck Depression Inventory (BDI) score ≥ 6,
- having hypertension, diabetes, stroke, and coronary heart disease,
- have drug abuse history,
- pregnancy or preparing to pregnancy,
- used immunotherapy or hormone therapy in past 1 years,
- participating in another clinical trial.
